x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.author: Nutanix
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.description:
NetBox is an open source web application designed to help manage and document computer networks. Initially conceived by the network engineering team at DigitalOcean, NetBox was developed specifically to address the needs of network and infrastructure engineers. It encompasses the following aspects of network management:

IP address management (IPAM) - IP networks and addresses, VRFs, and VLANs Equipment racks - Organized by group and site Devices - Types of devices and where they are installed Connections - Network, console, and power connections among devices Virtualization - Virtual machines and clusters Data circuits - Long-haul communications circuits and providers Secrets - Encrypted storage of sensitive credentials

License:
  • Apache License 2.0
Hardware Requirement:
  • By default 2vCPU, 4 GB RAM.
Resources Installed:
  • PostgreSQL - 9.6
  • Netbox - v2.11.8
  • Nginx
  • Redis
Operating System:
  • CentOS Linux release 7.8.2003
Platform:
  • AHV
  • VMWare
Lifecycle:
  • LDAP Auth
  • Upgrade
Limitations:
  • Single VM Netbox Instance. HA not available.
  • Not recommended for the production use.
Other Instructions:
  • Open port 80 under Firewall/Security group.
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.description_markdown:
NetBox is an open source web application designed to help manage and document computer networks. Initially conceived by the network engineering team at DigitalOcean, NetBox was developed specifically to address the needs of network and infrastructure engineers. It encompasses the following aspects of network management:
IP address management (IPAM) - IP networks and addresses, VRFs, and VLANs Equipment racks - Organized by group and site Devices - Types of devices and where they are installed Connections - Network, console, and power connections among devices Virtualization - Virtual machines and clusters Data circuits - Long-haul communications circuits and providers Secrets - Encrypted storage of sensitive credentials #### License: * Apache License 2.0 #### Hardware Requirement: * By default 2vCPU, 4 GB RAM. #### Resources Installed: * PostgreSQL - 9.6 * Netbox - v2.11.8 * Nginx * Redis #### Operating System: * CentOS Linux release 7.8.2003 #### Platform: * AHV * VMWare #### Lifecycle: * LDAP Auth * Upgrade #### Limitations: * Single VM Netbox Instance. HA not available. * Not recommended for the production use. #### Other Instructions: * Open port 80 under Firewall/Security group.
